title: CoHabit Mobile Application Design
longSummary: CoHabit is a mobile UI/UX case study focused on helping students find compatible roommates and manage shared living tasks. The project includes onboarding flows, interest-based roommate matching, chore scheduling tools, and a simple in-app messaging system. The design emphasizes clarity, accessibility, and mobile-first interaction patterns.
responsibilities: Conducted user research and created personas based on common roommate challenges
Designed low-fidelity wireframes and high-fidelity mobile prototypes in Figma
Built interactive prototypes to validate onboarding, matching, and task flows
Performed accessibility checks and iterative usability testing

title: StarFish Platform Redesign
longSummary: A visual and interaction redesign of StarFish, a student resource and support platform. The redesign improved service discoverability, reduced cognitive load, and strengthened the information hierarchy. Work included UI system updates, responsive component redesigns, and new navigation patterns to help students access resources more efficiently.
responsibilities: Performed heuristic evaluations and accessibility audits of the current platform
Created redesigned UI components and updated design tokens
Prototyped key flows and validated improvements through user feedback
Collaborated with developers to provide accessible markup and responsive styles

title: DishDive Website
longSummary: DishDive is an interactive recipe-sharing website built with plain HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. The design focuses on a clean, image-forward layout with features including recipe browsing, user commenting, rating interactions, filtering options, and responsive grid views for desktop and mobile.
responsibilities: Designed and implemented mobile-responsive layouts and components
Built interactive filtering, rating, and commenting UI with vanilla JavaScript
Optimized images and used lazy-loading to reduce page load times
Implemented accessible forms and improved keyboard navigation

title: LawBandit Home UI Redesign
longSummary: A UI/UX research-driven redesign of LawBandit, a legal education platform. The project examined user pain points and improved the homepage experience through clearer navigation, refined hierarchy, and more intuitive interactions. Deliverables included wireframes, prototypes, and recommended interaction patterns.
responsibilities: Conducted user research and mapped user journeys to identify issues
Created wireframes and interactive prototypes for improved homepage layouts
Documented design decisions and accessibility considerations for developers

title: Badger Mart – AI-Assisted Campus Marketplace Concept
longSummary: Badger Mart is an AI-assisted marketplace concept for UW–Madison students to list, buy, and sell items on campus. The project explores search and discovery patterns, mobile-first listing flows, and streamlined checkout interactions. The goal was to create a fast, intuitive marketplace experience.
responsibilities: Designed product listing, browsing, and search interfaces
Prototyped mobile-first posting and checkout flows
Iterated on pattern library elements for consistency

title: LPHIE Madison Chapter Website Redesign
longSummary: A full website redesign for the Lambda Phi Epsilon Madison chapter to modernize visuals, improve mobile responsiveness, and better support recruitment events. The rebuild includes responsive templates, event listings, and content structures tailored to the chapter’s communication and outreach needs.
responsibilities: Built responsive templates and event pages with semantic HTML and CSS
Improved content flow for recruitment and alumni engagement
Collaborated with chapter stakeholders to refine visuals and messaging
